required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Effectiveness of ST266 Ophthalmic Drops Compared to Placebo to Treat Allergic Conjunctivitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Double-Masked, Randomized, Phase 2 Evaluation of the Effectiveness of ST266 Ophthalmic Drops Compared to Placebo for the Treatment of Allergic Conjunctivitis Using a Modified Conjunctival Allergen Challenge Model

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of ST266 ophthalmic drops compared to placebo for the treatment of the signs and symptoms of allergic conjunctivitis.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study is a multi-center, double-masked, randomized, placebo-controlled, modified conjunctival allergen challenge (CAC) model. The primary endpoints of ocular itching and conjunctival redness will be evaluated at the subject's final visit. Subjects who meet inclusion criteria will be randomized to one of two treatment groups (1:1). Randomization will be stratified by average post-CAC itching scores at baseline.
Subjects will be evaluated at baseline and on Days 6, 7 and 8.

primary_outcome.description: Ocular itching evaluated by the subject.
Conjunctival redness evaluated by the investigator.

secondary_outcome.description: Ocular itching evaluated by the subject.
Conjunctival redness evaluated by the investigator.

arm_group.description: 1X ST266 dosed 4 times a day for 8 days
Placebo dosed 4 times a day for 8 days

intervention.description: One (1) drop of 1X ST266 ophthalmic eye drops will be administered to each eye 4 times a day for 8 days.
One (1) drop of saline ophthalmic eye drops will be administered to each eye 4 times a day for 8 days.
